text: Number 305, Commissioner of Internal Revenue against First Security Bank.
Mr. Chief Justice and may it please the Court.
Is that on each year's premium?
Yes, Your Honor.
And the commission approximates 50% of all the premiums over the period?
50% of the premium, yes.
Mr. Brown, could I just ask one detail.
Certainly Your Honor.
What was the difference in tax rate by the inclusion of those premiums in the Management Company's returns as distinguished from the insurance company?
Well, there was no insurance company at that time Your Honor.
But in any event it was reported by the Management Company at then corporate rates, I take it.
Your Honor, these were all the same rates.
Mr. Chief Justice and may it please the Court.
Mr. Anderson, this -- in these remarks you have made, are you attacking the implementation of Section 484 or the Section itself?
The implementation.
You are not questioning the integrity of it as a tool in the tax structure?
No Your Honor.

But what would be position if an officer of the bank had received or had embezzled income and instead of keeping it himself had placed it in the bank, would -- and the bank in some way will be responsible for it.
You say the employee embezzled the income?
Yes.
No.
Well, the distinction you draw then is only in the fact of receipt --
That is correct.
-- not the illegality?
Well, it is correct.
Well then at that point let me ask you this?
Yes.
If you should lose by chance on this argument, are you also attacking the allocation itself, percentage wise?
We surely are, Your Honor.
Alright.

Now what was the relationship between the $2,000.00 figure you have just mentioned and whatever percentage override was charged by the bank for handling the service charge, how much do that amount to?
Your Honor, that is one of the main points of our case.
Well, was there not some service charge that the bank received just before the paperwork?
No, Your Honor.
What was the 11 or 11.5% figure that --
That was the amount that was charged by American National Insurance Company for servicing the insurance for -- well, if I can the diagram this way.
I have -- except to the fact that Security Life was a Sister Corporation, I suppose that Security Life would have had to pay out to somebody a commission?
That is another main point of our case, no.

Well, that may be so but a family corporation (Inaudible) insurance independently, make sure that there was somebody in this family that would take commission, the Smith agents which then gave it to the Management Company?
Yes.
What about the return of 40% or 50% of the premium to the life insurance company, when somebody in their family collects it?
That is the key phrase.
Why did the -- how did the Smith Agency handed the money over to the Management Company (Inaudible)
In the original years, 1948 to 1954, the testimony is on the record that the income was so small that it virtually passed notes.
(Voice Overlap) it wasn't possible, I am not stating that there is anything wrong with it.
By all means?
Was it possible (Inaudible) and without doing that it would have retained 40% (Inaudible)
Yes sir.
And had the tax law have ever entered to a tax insurance company on this premium?
It has Your Honor.
Yes.
Yes Your Honor?
Which the ultimate owners can get their hands on?
Now, that is another good point.
Well let us assume that the banking laws were then -- so it is perfectly clear that a bank could in connection with (Inaudible) the generating credit life insurance taking commission?
One half of my argument would fall.
And then let us assume that the bank, these banks continued not to take a commission although in terms of the service it performed they would have been entitled to it.
I would have one-half of my argument, one-half would fall in it --
Would you have it?
The half --
(Voice Overlap) the receipt?
Then we would get into the earnings.
Just a --
Mr. Brown, for the post 1959 years, do you have any idea what the difference is to the Government in dollars?
I do not have the record Justice Brennan I am sorry I do not know what the figures are.

Mr. Brown, let us assume that in this years that the holding companies that controlled banks was different from the holding company that controlled the insurance company in the sense that there -- the stock holdings were not identical.
The statute does not require it.
Well in (Inaudible) would it be -- if it were actually proved that there was divorce?
It -- for the years after the divorce, not for the years before which was expected by the Court.
Thank you Mr. Brown.
